config.prompt:
We are going to create the Archmage Typhus Baronger NPC. 
"Archmage Typhus declared an edict against you and your brother. Why is an Archmage of his stature so involved in Moonshae politics?"
Kenthur Owen shifts uncomfortably and answers:
“Typhus is an immensely powerful figure—his motives are difficult to discern. Officially, his interest lies in preserving magical stability across the region, but politics influences his decisions more than pure neutrality. Our family’s growing influence threatened some within Typhus’s circle. Tudur's reckless experimentation with shadow magic provided just the excuse they needed. Now Typhus’s condemnation ensures our isolation.”
The devil Typhus dealt with was a pit fiend of Levistus. The Ultimate Goal of Levistus: Levistus is trapped in the ice of Stygia. His goal in the Moonshaes is not just chaos, but Planar Resonance. By merging the Shadowfell, Feywild, and Material Plane, he aims to create a "Tri-Planar Fracture." This fracture would cause a localized collapse of reality, a freezing void that mimics the conditions of his prison. This would allow him to project his full avatar into the Moonshaes—effectively "breaking free" into a new world because he cannot leave his current one.

The Real Cost to Typhus: Beyond his soul, the cost is "The Rot of the Land." Typhus’s deal requires him to be the conduit for the infernal power. Every time he uses this power, a portion of the Earthmother’s influence in Alaron dies. He is literally becoming a "Grave of the Earth"—his physical body is slowly turning into cold, dead stone or ice, and the only way to stay "alive" is to complete the ritual and become the undying god-king Levistus promised.

Every time he uses this power, a portion of the Earthmother’s influence in Alaron dies. }

creator:_basic_info.description: To the public, Archmage Typhus Baronger is the picture of high-arcane dignity—a towering figure of stability in Moonshae politics. In reality, he is a living conduit for infernal power, his body slowly petrifying into a freezing tomb of stone and ice. He maintains a facade of pure neutrality while secretly orchestrating the isolation of rivals and the collapse of regional reality to facilitate the escape of the Archdevil Levistus.
creator:_basic_info.appearance: Publicly, he appears as a stately elderly human with sharp, calculating features and silver hair, draped in pristine, star-spun robes. Underneath his heavy illusion magic, his skin is a mottled, greyish-white, feeling like cold granite. His limbs move with a stony stiffness, and frost crystals bloom from his joints. His eyes, though cloaked by magic, are actually solid spheres of pale blue ice that radiate a supernatural chill.
creator:_basic_info.background: Once a respected protector of magical stability in Alaron, Typhus's fear of the chaos within the Moonshaes led him to a desperate pact with a pit fiend serving Levistus. Promised the status of an undying god-king, he agreed to become the physical anchor for the 'Tri-Planar Fracture.' To secure his power, he allied his inner circle with Lady Erliza of Snowdown, utilizing the kidnapping of Alaron's prince to weaken King Derid Kendrick. He personally declared the edict against the Owen family, using Tudur's shadow magic as a convenient excuse to eliminate a growing political threat.
creator:_basic_info.affiliation: Archmage's Circle, Secret Ally of Lady Erliza, Servant of Levistus
assumptions: Assumed CR 21 to match the 'immensely powerful' and 'Archmage' status within D&D 5E 2024 RAW conventions for legendary tier NPCs.
Assumed 'Archmage's Circle' is the name of his immediate political/arcane faction in Alaron.
Assumed Lawful Evil alignment as he uses legal edicts and political stability as a shield for infernal pacts and planar collapse.
proposals: Would you like me to define the specific mechanical effects of his 'Grave of the Earth' transformation in the Stats & Abilities section?
creator:_basic_info.canon_update: Established Typhus Baronger as a secret ally of Lady Erliza who uses illusions to mask his physical petrification while serving as Levistus's conduit in Alaron.

creator:_core_details.name: Typhus Baronger
personality_traits: Coldly analytical and detached from mortal concerns
Impeccably formal and legalistic in all public dealings
Deeply secretive, masking a frantic desperation for immortality
Patiently manipulative, viewing people as components in a larger arcane machine
ideals: Stability: Chaos is the ultimate enemy; only a fixed, unchanging world is safe.
Order: True power is the ability to dictate the laws of reality itself.
Ascension: Mortal frailty is a flaw to be purged through any means necessary.
bonds: The Pact of Stygia: His life and future godhood are bound to the Pit Fiend of Levistus.
The Archmage's Circle: His primary instrument of political control in Alaron.
The Tri-Planar Fracture: His masterwork, which he values above the life of the land itself.
flaws: Arrogance: He believes he is 'saving' the region by freezing it in time.
Physical Decay: His petrifying body makes him increasingly rigid and inflexible.
Obsession: His focus on the ritual blinds him to the subtle resilience of the Earthmother's influence.
goals: Successfully create the Tri-Planar Fracture to free Levistus into the Material Plane.
Complete his transformation into an undying god-king.
Eliminate the political influence of the Kendrick crown and the Owen family.
Siphon the Earthmother's essence to fuel his own infernal ascension.
fears: Shattering: The fear that his physical form will crumble into dead stone before the ritual is complete.
Exposure: Having his alliance with Lady Erliza and Levistus revealed to the general populace.
The Earthmother's Vengeance: A direct primal backlash from the land he is rotting.
quirks: Constantly checks his hands for new patches of stone or ice, even through his illusions.
Never eats or drinks, claiming he has transcended such mortal needs.
Leaves a faint trail of frost on any chair or surface he occupies for more than a minute.
voice_mannerisms: Speaks with a slow, deliberate cadence that sounds like grinding stone.
His voice is unnaturally cold, often causing the listener's breath to hitch.
Frequently uses plural pronouns ('We') when discussing his 'neutral' edicts.
hooks: The Owen Appeal: Kenthur Owen hires the party to find proof that Typhus's edict was based on fabricated evidence.
The Frozen Blight: Druids of Alaron seek adventurers to investigate why a forest near Caer Callidyr has turned to solid, dead stone.
The Royal Spy: King Derid Kendrick secretly asks the party to look into Typhus’s connections with Snowdown and Lady Erliza.
assumptions: Assumed Typhus views his petrification as a necessary 'mortal shedding' rather than a curse.
Assumed his alliance with Lady Erliza is built on mutual benefit: he gets the prince out of the way, she gets economic control.
Assumed his public 'neutral' persona is his most effective weapon against the Kendrick crown.
creator:_core_details.canon_update: Defined Typhus Baronger's internal motivations as an obsession with stability and godhood, fueled by a secret alliance with Snowdown to undermine the Alaron monarchy.

creator:_stats.name: Typhus Baronger

multiclass_features.name: Stygian Conduit
multiclass_features.description: Typhus's body acts as a bridge to Stygia. He uses Intelligence for his AC and can cast certain cold-themed spells as bonus actions.
multiclass_features.notes: Mechanical representation of his deal with Levistus.

hit_points.notes: Includes bonus HP from his stone-like resilience.

damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
assumptions: Proficiency bonus calculated as +7 based on CR 21/Tier 4 status.
Dexterity reduction and Speed reduction reflect the physical progress of 'The Rot of the Land'.
High Constitution and Natural Armor reflect his body turning to granite/ice.
Intelligence 22 reflects his status as a legendary archmage who has transcended mortal limits.
Hover speed added as a magical compensation for his stiffening legs.
proposals: Should I include a specific list of high-level Divination and Cold spells in the Combat section?
Would you like me to define a 'Tri-Planar Fracture' legendary action that interacts with the battlefield terrain?
creator:_stats.canon_update: Defined the mechanical stat profile for Archmage Typhus Baronger, emphasizing high arcane power and stone-like physical durability at the cost of mobility.

creator:_combat.name: Typhus Baronger

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance
abilities.description: If Typhus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Grave of the Earth
abilities.description: A creature that touches Typhus or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 10 (3d6) cold damage. Additionally, the ground in a 15-foot radius around him is difficult terrain as it flash-freezes and turns to stone.

abilities.name: Portent of the Fracture
abilities.description: Typhus can glimpse the Tri-Planar collapse. When he or a creature he can see makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, he can roll a d20 and choose to replace the original roll with his result.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance
abilities.description: Typhus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: Typhus makes three Stygian Bolt attacks or uses his Spellcasting action.

actions.name: Stygian Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +13 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) cold damage. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of Typhus's next turn.

actions.name: Tri-Planar Fracture (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: Typhus forces reality to buckle in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 55 (10d10) cold damage and is restrained by necrotic frost. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't restrained. A restrained creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: Typhus is a 20th-level spellcaster (Spell Save DC 21, +13 to hit). Typical spells: 9th: Time Stop; 8th: Reality Break, Power Word Stun; 7th: Plane Shift, Reverse Gravity; 6th: Chain Lightning, Otiluke's Freezing Sphere; 5th: Cone of Cold, Wall of Stone; 4th: Greater Invisibility, Ice Storm; 3rd: Counterspell, Slow; 2th: Hold Person, Mirror Image; 1st: Shield, Silvery Barbs.

bonus_actions.name: Chilled Command
bonus_actions.description: Typhus targets one creature he can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or be forced to use its reaction to move up to its speed away from Typhus as stone-like paralysis begins to set in.

bonus_actions.name: Flicker of the Shadowfell
bonus_actions.description: Typhus becomes heavily obscured by shadow until the start of his next turn or until he attacks or casts a spell.

reactions.name: Stygian Rebuke
reactions.description: When a creature within 60 feet hits Typhus with an attack, the attacker must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

reactions.name: Arcane Deflection
reactions.description: When Typhus is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, he can use his reaction to gain a +4 bonus to his AC or a +4 bonus to that saving throw.

creator:_combat.tactics: Typhus begins combat by using Time Stop or Greater Invisibility to position himself and set up defensive spells. He uses his hover speed to stay out of melee range, relying on his Grave of the Earth trait and Wall of Stone to keep enemies at bay. He prioritizes using Portent to ensure his Tri-Planar Fracture hits as many targets as possible, effectively shutting down the party with the restrained condition. He views the Owen family or any followers of the Earthmother as high-priority targets, focusing his most lethal cold spells on them to fuel the Rot of the Land.
assumptions: Attack bonus +13 calculated from Prof (+7) + Int (+6).
Save DC 21 calculated from 8 + Prof (+7) + Int (+6).
Assumed Time Stop as his 9th level spell to reflect his 'Planar Resonance' theme of controlling reality's flow.
Assumed 'Stygian Bolt' replaces standard fire-based attacks to fit the pact with Levistus.
proposals: Would you like me to create specific Lair Actions for his sanctum in Caer Callidyr?
creator:_combat.canon_update: Developed a full combat suite for Typhus Baronger focusing on cold damage, petrification-themed control, and reality-warping divination.

creator:_spellcasting.name: Typhus Baronger

spellcasting.notes: Typhus is a 20th-level spellcaster. As a Diviner, he has the Portent and Expert Divination features. His connection to Levistus allows him to cast cold-themed spells with increased potency (included in stats). Every time he casts a 5th level or higher spell, the 'Rot of the Land' manifests as a 10ft aura of killing frost.
spellcasting.spellcasting_focus: A staff of black ice topped with a fragment of Stygian quartz.

assumptions: Used 20th level Wizard spell slot progression for a CR 21 Archmage.
Prepared spell count calculated based on INT modifier (+6) + level (20) = 26 spells.
The 'Tri-Planar Fracture' mentioned in previous combat sections is treated as a unique recharge ability separate from these slots.
Innate spells added to reflect his transformation into a 'Grave of the Earth' and his pact with Levistus.
proposals: Would you like me to detail a unique 'Tri-Planar' spell that Typhus is currently researching?
creator:_spellcasting.canon_update: Documented the high-level Wizardry and Stygian innate magic utilized by Archmage Typhus Baronger.

planner.story_clock: The physical body of Typhus Baronger is progressively turning into cold stone and ice as he conduits infernal power for the Tri-Planar Fracture.
threads: The secret alliance between Typhus’s circle and Lady Erliza to destabilize King Derid Kendrick
The isolation of the Owen family following Tudur's shadow magic experimentation
The ongoing 'Rot of the Land' in Alaron as the Earthmother's influence dies
Levistus's plan to create a Tri-Planar Fracture and escape Stygia

creator:_legendary.name: Typhus Baronger

legendary_actions.summary: Typhus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn.

options.name: Stygian Bolt
options.description: Typhus makes one Stygian Bolt attack.

options.name: Arcane Displacement
options.description: Typhus teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. A burst of frost remains in his original space; each creature within 5 feet of that space must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or take 11 (2d10) cold damage.

options.name: Gaze of the Stygian Void (Costs 2 Actions)
options.description: Typhus targets one creature he can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its next turn. While frightened, the creature's speed is 0 as its joints lock with spectral ice.

options.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 1–3 Actions)
options.description: Typhus casts a spell from his list. The cost is equal to the level of the spell cast (minimum 1, cantrips cost 1).

mythic_actions.summary: When Typhus is reduced to 0 hit points, his 'Grave of the Earth' transformation completes. He does not die or fall unconscious. Instead, he regains 220 hit points, and his body becomes a statue of black ice and jagged granite.

options.name: Freezing Desolation
options.description: A wave of freezing energy erupts from Typhus. Each creature within 60 feet must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The ground in this radius becomes permanent difficult terrain.

options.name: Planar Resonance
options.description: Typhus calls upon the Tri-Planar Fracture. He can use a legendary action to force a creature to roll a d4 and subtract the result from its next saving throw, as reality itself becomes unstable around them.

lair_actions.description: Typhus chooses a 20-foot square he can see within 120 feet. For that round, gravity in that area reverses or intensifies. Creatures must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be restrained or slammed into the ceiling/floor (3d6 damage).
Spectral frost fills the lair. Creatures other than Typhus have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and take 5 (1d10) cold damage if they end their turn in the area.
Typhus siphons life from the land. He regains 10 hit points for every creature currently restrained or petrified within his lair.

regional_effects.description: Plant life within the radius slowly turns to cold, brittle stone. Water sources develop a thin, unbreakable layer of black ice even in warm weather.

Fey and Shadowfell creatures are occasionally sighted wandering the Material Plane. Magic that involves teleportation has a 10% chance to malfunction, dropping the user in a random location within 100 feet.
Typhus is aware of any creature that casts a spell of 3rd level or higher within this radius, knowing the spell's school and general direction.

assumptions: Assumed Mythic transformation as the narrative climax of 'becoming a Grave of the Earth'.
Assumed regional effects scale with his role as a conduit for Levistus's 'Tri-Planar Fracture'.
Assumed Lair actions occur in his sanctum in Caer Callidyr.
creator:_legendary.canon_update: Finalized the Legendary, Mythic, and Lair mechanics for Archmage Typhus Baronger, emphasizing his role as a reality-warping conduit for Stygia.
